1.brief: a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
near, with or among; often in general, to
Micah, the name of seven Israelites
a Morashtite or inhabitant of Moresheth-Gath
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
Jotham, the name of three Israelites
Achaz, the name of a Jewish king and of an Israelite
Chizkijah, a king of Judah, also the name of two other Israelites
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have avision of
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine

2.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to prick up the ears, i.e. hearken
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
concretely, a witness; abstractly, testimony; specifically, a recorder, i.e. prince
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
a large public building, such as a palace or temple
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

4.brief: to liquefy; figuratively, to waste (with disease), to faint (with fatigue, fear or grief)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
to cleave; generally, to rend, break, rip or open
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to flow; figuratively, to stretch out; causatively, to pour out or down; figuratively, to deliver over
a descent; as architecture, an ornamental appendage, perhaps a festoon

5.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine

6.brief: to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
something planted, i.e. the place (a garden or vineyard), or the thing (a plant, figuratively or men); by implication, the act, planting
to flow; figuratively, to stretch out; causatively, to pour out or down; figuratively, to deliver over
a gorge (from its lofty sides; hence, narrow, but not a gully or winter-torrent)
to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal

7.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a gift (as the price of harlotry or idolatry)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)

a gift (as the price of harlotry or idolatry)

to commit adultery (usually of the female, and less often of simple fornication, rarely of involuntary ravishment); figuratively, to commit idolatry (the Jewish people being regarded as the spouse of Jehovah)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

8.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, to tear the hair and beat the breasts (as Orientals do in grief); generally to lament; by implication, to wail
to howl (with a wailing tone) or yell (with a boisterous one)
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
a marine or land monster, i.e. sea-serpent or jackal
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)

9.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be frail, feeble, or (figuratively) melancholy
a wound; figuratively, carnage, also pestilence
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory

properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
an opening, i.e. door or gate
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine

10.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud

11.brief: to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
shame (the feeling and the condition, as well as its cause); by implication (specifically) an idol
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
properly, to tear the hair and beat the breasts (as Orientals do in grief); generally to lament; by implication, to wail
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

12.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
an opening, i.e. door or gate
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine

13.brief: to yoke up (to the pole of a vehicle)
a relay of animals on a post-route (as stored up for that purpose); by implication, a courser
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
the first, in place, time, order or rank (specifically, a firstfruit)
an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem

properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

14.brief: properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
(only in plural) a dismissal, i.e. (of a wife) divorce (especially the document); also (of a daughter) dower
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
Akzib, the name of two places in Palestine
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

15.brief: properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
to occupy (by driving out previous tenants, and possessing in their place); by implication, to seize, to rob, to inherit; also to expel, to impoverish, to ruin
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
Mareshah, the name of two Israelites and of a place in Palestine
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

16.brief: to cut off; specifically to shear aflock or shave the hair; figuratively to destroy an enemy
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to broaden (intransitive or transitive, literal or figurative)
the eagle (or other large bird of prey)
